definition: to bestow (a reward)/to give (to an inferior)/to hand down/a reward (bestowed by a superior)/to appreciate (beauty)

sentences.english: Pretentious has always been the subject of frequent combat is certainly a reason.
sentences.chinese: 總是孤芳自賞卻屢受衝擊肯定是有緣故原由的。

sentences.english: If nobody appreciate you, you still can be narcissistic.
sentences.chinese: 全世界都沒人欣賞，自己依然可以孤芳自賞。

sentences.english: Rolled with the whitecaps, gurgling sound of water, secluded orchid in a deserted Valley, indulge in self-admiration.
sentences.chinese: 翻卷着的白浪，淙淙的流水聲，空谷幽蘭，孤芳自賞。

sentences.english: I don’t think I’m alone in this.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲我並非孤芳自賞。

sentences.english: Perhaps film suits him better than fine arts, which are more introspective and self-absorbed.
sentences.chinese: 或許，對於孤芳自賞的美術來說，電影更適合他。

definition: elated/light and airy feeling (after a few drinks)/smug and conceited/complacent
to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
tied up in a bundle on a high shelf/to put sth on the back burner/no longer a high priority
to have talent but no opportunity (idiom)/to be an unrecognized talent
to spin a cocoon around oneself (idiom); enmeshed in a trap of one's own devising/hoist by his own petard
to show respect from a distance (idiom)/to remain at a respectful distance
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
